stockmarket.gui.dialog

Class TransactionDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvp.listener.AbstractListenerDialog
      • stockmarket.gui.dialog.AbstractDefaultDialog
        • stockmarket.gui.dialog.TransactionDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, mvp.listener.ListenerDialog, mvp.listener.ListenerView
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuyDialog, SellDialog

    @NotThreadSafe
public abstract class TransactionDialog
extends AbstractDefaultDialog
    An extension of the AbstractDefaultDialog framework. Most of that class's methods have been implemented here, with a host of new abstract methods provided for creating transaction dialogs. Transaction dialogs are used for performing an operation on a certain quantity of shares of a stock.

    In order to extend this class, two of the abstract methods from the base dialog API, createIcon() and createTitleBarText(), must be implemented. In additon, there are four more abstract methods must be implemented to integrate with the transaction-specific design of this class. These methods provide both visual elements and key components for executing the type of transaction determined by the subclass.

    limitLabelText() returns the text for the label describing what is serving as the limit on the number of shares that can be involved in the transaction.

    limitValueText() returns the text for the label displaying the value of that limit. This does NOT need to be the actual raw number of how many shares can be involved in the transaction, and can be any value that ultimately determines what that limit is.

    shareLimit() returns the exact number of shares that is the limit on the transaction. This value is used in the actual operation performed by this dialog.

    transactionButton() the button that executes the transaction. Essentially the "Ok" button of the dialog, but this method allows a more specialized implementation.

    Other features of this class include a bound slider and text field. Both are used to set the quantity of shares involved in this transaction, and both will dynamically change to remain synchronized with the other.

    THREAD SAFETY: Swing is NOT thread safe.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig

    • Method Detail

      • setStock

        public void setStock(Stock stock)
        Set the stock that is being used in this transaction. NOTE: the stock needs to already have downloaded its values, or else this operation will take place with outdated data, or possibly not even have the necessary data at all.
        Parameters:
        stock - the stock that is being used in this transaction.

        protected javax.swing.JButton[] addButtons()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDefaultDialog
        Adds buttons to the bottom button panel of the dialog. These buttons are returned in an array, and will be added from left-to-right in the order they appear in the array. All buttons will be right-aligned in the panel.

      • limitLabelText

        protected abstract java.lang.String limitLabelText()
        This method should return the text for the label defining the maximum limit on the number of shares that can be a part of this transaction. This returns only a label naming what that limit is, not the value of that limit.
        Returns:
        the text for the label naming the limit on this transaction

      • limitValueText

        protected abstract java.lang.String limitValueText()
        This method should return text representing the value of the maximum limit on the number of shares that can be a part of this transaction. This value does not have to be an actual number of shares, it can be any value that has the effect of restricting the number of shares.
        Returns:
        the text of the value of the limit on this transaction.

      • shareLimit

        protected abstract int shareLimit()
        This method should return an integer value that is the limit on the maximum amount of shares that can be used in a transaction by this dialog.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of shares that can be used in a transaction by this dialog.

      • createTransactionButton

        protected abstract javax.swing.JButton createTransactionButton()
        This method should return the button to execute the transaction. This is the equivalent of "ok" or "execute", but labeled based on the type of transaction.
        Returns:
        the button to execute the transaction.
